issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We have a multi-cluster test environment which is periodically loosing a partition (i.e. a whole availability zone).  The additional AZ components no longer show in euca-describe-services after the event.  In the cloud-error.log @ debug level we see:

{code}
Tue Jan 8 14:16:05 2013 ERROR [UDPHandler:Thread-38] [com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.UDPHandler.run(UDPHandler.java):155] java.net.SocketException: Socket closed
Tue Jan 8 14:16:05 2013 ERROR [TCPListener:Thread-37] [com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.TCPListener.run(TCPListener.java):103] java.net.SocketException: Socket closed
Tue Jan 8 14:16:05 2013 ERROR [TCPListener:Thread-37] [com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.TCPListener.run(TCPListener.java):99] Cannot start service. Invalid socket.
Tue Jan 8 14:16:32 2013 ERROR [ComponentDiscovery:main] [com.eucalyptus.component.ComponentDiscovery.processClass(ComponentDiscovery.java):83] java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException

	at com.eucalyptus.util.Classes.newInstance(Classes.java:231)

Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: com.eucalyptus.component.ComponentIds$1.<init>()
	at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:2723)
	at java.lang.Class.getConstructor(Class.java:1674)
	at com.eucalyptus.util.Classes$InstanceBuilder.newInstance(Classes.java:195)
	... 9 more
Tue Jan 8 14:16:32 2013 ERROR [TypeMappers:main] [com.eucalyptus.util.TypeMappers$TypeMapperDiscovery.processClass(TypeMappers.java):138] class com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceConfigurations$ServiceBuilderMapper looks like it is a @TypeMapper but needs generics: [interface com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceConfiguration]

At the same time we see the following in cloud-fault.log:

{code}
  ERR-1011 2013-01-08 14:16:43 CLC will not start with the /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/partitioned.lock present on the file system.

   condition: /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/partitioned.lock is present
       cause: Disabled CLC started out of order.
   initiator: Eucalyptus
    location: localhost
  resolution:
        The system has undergone a network partition that lead to a network split between the cloud controllers (CLCs).
        The CLCs may have become inconsistent and to avoid data loss the system has fail-stopped.
        If you are able to determine which of the CLC hosts has your canonical data (HOST_1) and which one doesn't (HOST_2), then:
        0. Backup the /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/ directory on both HOST_1 and HOST_2.
        1. Delete /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/partitioned.lock on HOST_1.
        2. Start /etc/init.d/eucalyptus-cloud on HOST_1.
        3. Verify that the service is working as expected on HOST_1.
        4. Really. Convince yourself you haven't chosen the wrong database state.
        5. Delete /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data/partitioned.lock on HOST_2.
        6. Start /etc/init.d/eucalyptus-cloud on HOST_2.
        7. Verify that the system comes back up and behaves as you expected.
        Please report any problems or post a question on https://engage.eucalyptus.com/
{code}

No partitioned.lock file exists.

The CC in the lost partition reports (cc.log):

{code}
2013-01-08 14:16:05 ERROR | couldn't connect to host (7)
2013-01-08 14:16:05  WARN | removing /tmp/euca-clcnet-hUkxXz
2013-01-08 14:16:05  WARN | cannot get latest network topology from cloud controller
2013-01-08 14:16:05  WARN | cannot get network ground truth from CLC
2013-01-08 14:16:11 ERROR | couldn't connect to host (7)
2013-01-08 14:16:11  WARN | removing /tmp/euca-clcnet-zvVZtW
2013-01-08 14:16:11  WARN | cannot get latest network topology from cloud controller
2013-01-08 14:16:11  WARN | cannot get network ground truth from CLC
2013-01-08 14:16:17 ERROR | couldn't connect to host (7)
2013-01-08 14:16:17  WARN | removing /tmp/euca-clcnet-Fom1xM
2013-01-08 14:16:17  WARN | cannot get latest network topology from cloud controller
2013-01-08 14:16:17  WARN | cannot get network ground truth from CLC
2013-01-08 14:16:24  INFO | instances: 0009 (0009 extant + 0000 pending + 0000 terminated)
2013-01-08 14:16:24  INFO |     nodes: 0002 (0002 busy + 0000 idle + 0000 unresponsive)
2013-01-08 14:16:24 ERROR | couldn't connect to host (7)
{code}

The SC (which is not fully configured due to another issue) reports:

{code}
Tue Jan 8 14:16:21 2013 ERROR [DBResourceCheck:pool-27-thread-1] [com.eucalyptus.troubleshooting.checker.DBResourceCheck$DBChecker.run(DBResourceCheck.java):224] db resource check failed for eucalyptus_auth
java.util.NoSuchElementException
        at java.util.TreeMap$PrivateEntryIterator.nextEntry(TreeMap.java:1115)
        at java.util.TreeMap$EntryIterator.next(TreeMap.java:1153)
        at java.util.TreeMap$EntryIterator.next(TreeMap.java:1148)
        at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractInvocationHandler.entry(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:210)
        at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.DriverReadInvocationStrategy.invoke(DriverReadInvocationStrategy.java:41)
        at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractInvocationHandler.invoke(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:97)
        at $Proxy61.hashCode(Unknown Source)
        at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ProxyConnection.getDelegateHashcode(ProxyConnection.java:471)
        at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ConnectionPool.getConnectionInfos(ConnectionPool.java:841)
        at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ProxoolFacade.getSnapshot(ProxoolFacade.java:733)
        at com.eucalyptus.troubleshooting.checker.DBResourceCheck$DBPoolInfo.getActiveConnections(DBResourceCheck.java:102)
        at com.eucalyptus.troubleshooting.checker.DBResourceCheck$DBChecker.run(DBResourceCheck.java:209)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRunAndReset(FutureTask.java:351)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:178)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:165)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:267)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1110)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:603)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:679)
{code}

Here is the euca-describe-services output:

{code}
[root@g-19-01 ~]# euca-describe-services 
SERVICE	storage        	greek          	argyron        	NOTREADY  	675 	http://10.105.1.126:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:greek:storage:argyron/
SERVICE	cluster        	greek          	aktaios        	ENABLED   	675 	http://10.104.1.126:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:greek:cluster:aktaios/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	merlin         	ENABLED   	675 	http://10.104.1.125:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:merlin/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.1.125   	ENABLED   	675 	http://10.104.1.125:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.1.125/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.125   	ENABLED   	675 	http://10.104.1.125:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.1.125/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.125   	ENABLED   	675 	http://10.104.1.125:8773/services/Dns   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.1.125/
{code}

... which is missing the other CC and SC which showed prior to the event.

Checking the CLC and CC + SC's there are no signs of loss of network connectivity in system logs. 

System is accessible for Engineering.
fields.environment: non-HA 2 x AZ cloud - single CLC with 2 x CC+SC

comments.body: If you want to access the system, please notify me.  I need at least one AZ working tomorrow for a customer demo :)

Looking at cloud logs, this has happened repeatedly over the Christmas period, so it keeps happening ...

Cloud status:  currently broken and being looked at for clues.

The DBResourceCheck errors are a known issue and do not directly indicate a problem with the SC. Those messages only occur when the SC (or any java component) is on a different host than the CLC. I'm not sure why the db pool checks fail, but they do not indicate that the SC cannot contact the DB. It is merely a periodic resource usage check that examines how many DB connections are active. That same message will be shown on a system that is running normally.
Thanks Zach, ok so likely unrelated issues between this and the SC aggregate.

The loosing a partition issue could be related but that specific error message is likely not. The netapp aggregate setting issue is due to the fact that the SC is not fully initializing for some reason. We haven't seen what that is yet, but it could be related to the partition issue if the partition is lost from the CLC before the SC initializes. I'm not sure what is wrong yet, but I suspect a network-related issue around the CLC. Unfortunately, I don't have time to look into this much yet, just wanted to give you what little info I have right now.
Gotcha.  Ok, thanks.
Chris, if you have an update on this please provide it in the bug.
Hi [~decker], did you manage to take a look at this?
CLC team has patch to review
